title.narrative: EDUCATION SOUTH SYRIA

description.narrative: Syria's conflict-affected population have their critical Education needs met, in line with the HRP and as part of the UNICEF JOP., which contributes to Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equitable Access To Quality Education (Covid), Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: MENARO delivers timely, equitable and principled humanitarian action as a complement to country office-led operations where required, including through the cross-border component of the Syria programmes as part of the Whole of Syria response.

participating-org.narrative: WHITE HATS ORGANIZATIONS BEYAZ SAPKALILAR YARDIMLASMA VE DAYANISMA DERNEGI

System strengthening - inclusive education for other vulnerable children poorest quintile, ethnic/linguistic minorities, migrant children, non-citizens/undocumented children etc.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Syria's conflict-affected population have their critical Education needs met, in line with the HRP and as part of the UNICEF JOP.

description.narrative: In 2020, the non-renewal of the cross-border resolution, and UNICEF’s decision to no longer programme cross border into Northeast Syria, the WoS programme was not able to continue activities. This meant a change to UNICEF’s cross border programmes in NES, but not to its commitment to engaging on quality humanitarian assistance. UNICEF worked with all partners, who had active programmes with UNICEF at the time of the resolution change, to discuss and finalize outstanding commitments, on basis of programme criticality considerations. The Amman hub continued its role in coordination, convening, and capacity building. | Status:Discontinued | As-of Date:22/03/2021
